intro: Eugeissona minor, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Eugeissona minor is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert habitats.
